Thanks Alan,
I bought the blade in shirasaia storage mount. I plan to add furniture 
to it and use it to practice. Its a little over 2.45 shaku in 
length..... perfect size for me. I was surprised at the length, I didn't 
think too many were made to that length, especially in the middle 1600. 
Adding a groove would lighten it and add sound to the cuts. I know 
someone that sent a koto blade to Japan to have a bo-hi put on. They did 
a beautiful job, several collectors have seen it and said that it did 
not detract from the beauty of the sword. As I said in previous 
responses I don't plan to ruin the sword and if I will do it it will be 
sent to Japan to an expert.
Enore
